Just OK . The plot line is very intriguing . . . America in the not - too - distant future struggling with debt and a devastating earthquake in LA . I love apocalyptic fiction and the description instantly appealed to me . While I stayed interested enough to finish the book , however , I did find it corny candor unbelievable in some places . I think the number one element that makes any apocalyptic novel good is the believability , and this one misses the mark in some instances . I do n't believe that in less 20 years from now , we 're all going to have lifelike robots - and if they do exist , I 'm sure they 'll be quite expensive and not something most of us would have . I also do n't believe the contrived reason for the debt problem people living longer because of a cancer cure . The author did n't even need to contrive a reason for a debt crisis we have one right now that is all too real . Witness this morning 's headlines that the SP downgraded our credit rating . Despite the flaws in the book , I liked it enough to finish it . But , really , I would n't recommend to anyone that they go out and buy it .

First the good - the plot is not too bad . First the good - the plot is not too bad , and the novel moves along at a steady clip . It managed to hold my attention - but barely . At times the author struggled with keeping the storyline cohesive . There is a lot of repetition of background material throughout the novel , perhaps this is the authors way of trying to make sure he does n't lose the readers among all the plot threads . But personally , I found this a bit tiresome and more experienced writers avoid the impression of background material repetition , or at least when they do repeat , they do n't insult the readers intelligence by providing incremental information each time they repeat some background . The biggest flaw I found in this novel though was the very weak ending . I was quite baffled by the way the novel lets many lose threads simply hang at the end without a satisfactory explanation .

A delightful read ! This was a delightful coming of age book about a 25 - year - old Ghanaian woman , Maddie , who has spent much of her young adult life caring for her father who has Parkinson Disease . Her overbearing , absent most of the time mother is of little help and her older brother is no help at all to her either . One day to her mother decides to return home to London from the Hostel she has been running in Ghana in order to look after Maddie 's father . Maddie takes this opportunity to rent an apartment with two other young women . Lots of funny things happen as Maddie learns how to navigate the dating scene with clubbing and online dating . Mattie is very unsure of herself and asks Google tons of questions . I enjoyed this book but I did find that the second half slowed down somewhat , but overall it is a good book .

A fun enough way to pass the time if you do n't have something more original to read . I enjoyed this book although the characters and writing were pretty generic . The novel kept up a good page - turning pace that never required hard thinking . A few nice turns in the story helped the adventure stay interesting , although the personal lives of the characters were not all that original or moving . There were some good original details regarding setting and location , and the several different narrative perspectives worked well enough . The best part of the book was the way Olsen portrayed the romantic and emotional involvements of several of the women characters with potential serial killers . The portrayals did n't seem necessarily deeply convincing or realistic , but they did n't feel obviously phony either , and their weirdness gave this fairly standard tale some more original moments . A lot of books this generic bore me and I put them down , but this is one I was happy enough to finish although I doubt Ill be picking up more Olson titles any time soon .

A good book cheapened by the ending . I was all set to give this book 5 stars . And I would have done so were it not for the last chapter . That last chapter cheapened the story and made the effort of reading this very harrowing book worthless for me . I found Handle with Care a very compelling and affecting book , despite the many plots and very distracting and bizarrely included recipes . Why ? it was a very interesting experience to read a book where I did n't agree with anything the main protagonist did but still liked her in a way . The ending made me want to literally throw the book at a wall , and I would have had I not been listening to the end while driving my car . I was doing double duty with this book reading the print version and also listening to the audio depending on where I was . I have read other books by Jodi Picoult so really should have expected what she did at the end , especially after " My Sisters Keeper " . In hindsight , it was quite predictable . After this heavy tale of unending misery I need a serious fluff infusion .

There is a very good exploration on the theme of racism , it 's important to the story , making you think during the break neck investigation and exploration of this alternate now that Carey has crafted . But this is a good start , and it already feels like the world building Carey excels at could continue into a much greater tale by the end .

NOT for Beginners . Was required to purchase this lab manual for a college General Chemistry course I am taking . If not required I would NEVER have purchased it . This might be good for higher level chemistry courses or a graduate level course but not for a freshman chemistry course . The experiments are basically presented as SUPPOSEDLY " real world situations problems " that your team has to find the solution to then report back how you " fixed " the problem . The text gives you very little information and no real guidance on how to tackle the problems presented . It relies entirely too much on the student being intuitive . It presumes a level of knowledge and experience that the average college freshman or sophomore does not possess . I definitely WOULD NOT RECOMMEND this lab manual if you have a choice . I unfortunately did not . It was definitely a waste of my money .

A great character , a bit too much going on . This was my first Rebus book and I came away impressed by Rankin 's ability to put a new twist on the loner cop . Rebus , with his inability to let things remain status que , proves to be an excellent protagonist , his interest in music a nice trait and his heavy drinking understandable given his sense of isolation . Scotland as a setting proved to be fascinating for this American reader and the police procedural nature of the book is well - served by Rankin 's attention to detail . But I did find there was a bit too much going on , an old case coming back to haunt Rebus , two serial killers , a murder that involves big oil and big crime , and one of those unresolved endings that really could have been resolved without any great difficulty . This was just too many threads to tie together successfully , but in away I like the idea that Rankin feels the need to challenge the reader within the confines of this type of mystery . I 'll definitely give Inspector Rebus another look .

A very inspirational book . A Life Aligned With Mary Magdalene was a good novella . It sounds like it would be a Christian novel , but due to an f - word , I would n't consider it such . However , it was a very good book . In the book , Mary finds out that she is a lot like Mary Magdalene . She also has a spiritual awakening through Jesus Christ . The meeting scene was a little confusing . I did n't understand what was going on until a few pages into it . It was interesting hearing about Mary 's life as a prostitute . The pimp was a bit scary at times . I felt bad for Mary , but I did n't understand how she could let him treat her the way he did . I also did n't understand why , in her next relationship , she knew the signs that her boyfriend was being abusive , but still went back to him everytime . I liked this book . The story of Mary was very inspiring to me . She had a very rough life , but she still made the best of it . I am excited to read the next book in the series when it is released . I ca n't wait to find out what happens between Mary and her Prince Charming .

book is too big and heavy . I am going to make a criticism which will sound trivial or laughable . One would not criticize Newton 's Principia for being physically large , right ? A Bit Involved , Even for a Heavy Reader , But Good Story . I love a novel that I can sink into and fall in love with the characters . and a trilogy ? A dream . This novel was very involved , detailed and somewhat historical . but I will say that I really loved the first half of this book a lot more than I loved it towards the end . I feel like Harkness did n't know how to end it and then just kept writing and writing , adding more and more detail until she realized that she had two more sequels to write . I do recommend this book to friends who likes the witches and vampire genre , and I did love this book , even looking forward to the second book . However , as the book approached , I realized that I did n't really want to jump back into the story of these two characters and maybe it 's not as great as I thought . The historical references are a little bit too much , but the character build up is very good . This is the type of book that you like really based on personal preference and not too much regarding the story . Try it and then you will know if you love or hate it , it 's worth the try .

Intentions . The second crime novel by Tim OMara to feature Raymond Donne is titled , Crooked Numbers , and I liked this one even more than his debut novel , Sacrifice Fly . I enjoyed the sharp dialogue in this novel , which always seemed to me to capture the way characters such as the ones in this novel would really speak . Donne works as a dean at a middle school . One of his former students was murdered , and when the boys mother asks him to try to get the police to take more action to solve the case , he intends to nudge his former NYPD colleagues , but not interfere . For most of the novel , Donne interferes , despite his best intentions . All the characters are well developed in this novel , and the many ways in which Donne interacts with kids , parents , criminals and the police provided me with hours of entertainment . The pacing of this novel was faster than the earlier book . Any reader who likes well - written character - based crime fiction should consider reading this one . Rating Four - star I like it

From Great Read to Self - indulgent Navel Gazing . For a company whose mantra is " Story Is King " , it seems to fizzle after the first 80 pages . It was great read while it stuck close to the action surrounding the building of a fascinating industry with all its drama that only a founder can provide . I was loving it ! However , it may be that as Pixar found success , the author was no longer in the trenches and close enough to provide the play by play he had in earlier chapters . Instead , we suddenly leave the storyline and make a rapid turn toward self - indulgent navel - gazing . Intimate details that had captivated us in early chapters are now replaced by shallow sloganeering and dull philosophizing . Now for my disclaimer . I did n't finish it . Bored , I found myself skipping paragraphs , then pages , and finally deciding to just put it down . However , since I invested in the hardcover edition expecting it to be a keeper , I suspect that I 'll pick it up again some time down the road and skim it for any interesting anecdotes that I may have missed . But as it stands now , it 's shelved .

I Never Throw Books Away , But I May Make An Exception . Bar none , this is the worst book I 've ever read . From the synopsis , I was expecting a witty , whimsical story in the style of a Julia Quinn . In reality , this is a tedious , lackluster high school English assignment gone wrong . Apparently this author never learned the value of a compound sentence making the flow of the book stilted and jarring . The cardboard characters in the book are one dimensional and totally unbelievable , and the dialogue is absolutely ridiculous . Ms. English attempts to blend 19th century manners with 21st century colloquialisms and is predictably unsuccessful . The basic plot of the book is about a girl who grew up wanting to be her father 's son who is forced into a marriage with a chauvinistic man who approaches her like she 's a horse he needs to break to the saddle . Been there , done that - but in the hands of someone who actually knows how to write , it can be a fun adventure . In this author 's hands it is boring and amateurish . Bottom line , I wo n't be buying any more books by Christy English .

Entwined . Audrey Niffenegger gives readers over 400 pages of finely written prose in her novel , Her Fearful Symmetry . I found myself mesmerized by this odd story of two generations of twins whose lives and relationships are entwined . A supporting cast of characters provide plot movement and opportunity for Niffenegger to display her skill in character development . Readers with low tolerance for the paranormal will be overwhelmed by how much of the novel is outside the world we can see and feel . Readers willing to suspend disbelief and allow the novel to proceed will be rewarded by the behavior of character that disclose fundamentals about the ways we relate to one another . I suggest any reader sample some pages before committing to this unusual novel . Rating Three - star Recommended

Too dark for my taste . I liked the portrait of late 1940s LA . It was interesting to see that there was once a viable Republican Party in the state and in the City of Los Angeles . As for the story , Ellroy lays on the sadism , brutality , hatred , greed , duplicity with too much of a trowel . The characters are too flawed to be at all likable or interesting . I permanently lost interest in Bucky about the third or fourth time he roughed someone up without a decent reason or started throwing someones furniture around . The scene late in the book where he shoots up Mr. Spragues bedroom along with his Picasso , Rembrandt et al . was embarrassingly amateurish . I could visualize one of my junior high class mates creating a similar scene . Ellroy is a good writer technically . His vision is not mine though . As much as I loved and revered LA Confidential , I wo nt be coming back his way again . Meaninglessly dark and gruesome .

Misleading . Too much politics and not enough financial data . Since this author is a noted financial guru , I was curious to know his take on the potential crash of the US dollar . Unfortunately , I got too little of the author 's financial expertise and too much of the author 's opinions on politics , diet , and energy . The book starts off good with some well written financial history and some good insight by the author . However , most of the book is the author 's personal views with a little financial information sprinkled in . I agreed with the author on several of his points but I found myself wanting more financial data . If you 're looking for a good financial book about the crash of the US dollar this is not it .

For Anyone in the British Navy Only . I bought this book because it promised to involve the WWII German battleships , and , since hubby and I are fascinated by anything WWII , marine warfare , and especially submarines , I thought this book would be right up our alley . It was NOT . We did not like this book AT ALL . It is very dry and boring , at least it was to us . As I read it aloud to hubby , he kept falling asleep . But to anyone in the Navy , I imagine it would be great reading - and especially for anyone in the BRITISH navy . We could not understand a lot of the terminology , did not understand what they were talking about , nor did we care . The plot - I assume there was supposed to be one - was hard to find . If you 're looking for a good book on German marine warfare , pick up " Das Boot " instead .

Terrible . I found myself using the fast forward button to get past all of the useless , meaningless information that the author felt was important for me to know . I am a fan of being able to visualize a scene and getting plenty of detail however I am not going to become a florist and I do n't need a step to step guide on making a bouquet , what type of sticky double back tape to use , what flowers to use , et . Painful . The filler was used to make up for uninteresting characters . The main character of the story was frustratingly pathetic , could n't make a good decision if it was the only decision she had presented to her , and seemed to be on the verge of a nervous breakdown the entire book . I do n't think she could have been more unlikable . Finally , I love a good plot twist but it seems to me that there has to be at least something to look back on to say " Ahhh , how did I miss that ? " when the plot is revealed . Not the case is this book - the final reveal is ridiculous and you realize you just wasted 4 hours of your life .

Talented writer but a problematic ending . I found it hard to put this book down , the author is very talented a master of scary scenes laced with humor . I do n't want to give away the ending but there was a continuity problem and the trite wrap up did not match the rest of the brilliant writing evident in the rest of the book . Again , Mr. Tufo is very talented and I will be reading another of his books with the hopes he was given the time to wrap up his other novels properly .

Important ideas skim or read a summary . The ideas put forward here , that it 's possible to improve outcomes without limiting choice , are important and hugely valuable . They need to be taken seriously by policymakers and " choice architects " everywhere . That said , the book itself is a pretty dull read . I made the mistake of getting the audiobook version , which makes it difficult to skim over sections that go on and on and on and . The regular book is a better choice after reading a couple of chapters you get the general idea , then you can skip to the application of the approach in areas you 're interested in , rather than slogging through all the basically equivalent examples .

I enjoyed it , but feel kind of guilty about that . I found this an incredibly light read , enjoyable in the way that a guilty - pleasure beach book would be . I liked learning about the stones themselves . However , anyone with even a passing interest in history or a decent high school level education would know the history presented , and like other reviewers , I sincerely doubt that jewels alone were the major catalysts in the historical events presented . I also took exception to the author 's sometimes - arrogant style and the habit of presenting the Catholic Church as arch villain over and over again while no one argues the point that there are shameful episodes in the Church 's history , do we really need " clever " comments like " this puts the pick in Catholic " ? Juvenile . And I was put off by the plethora of spelling errors du Berry ? du Barry ? " fluorescence " or " florescence " ? et . I also do n't understand why the author found it necessary to footnote items of generally accepted historical truth . There are times when these unnecessary footnotes are about on the level of footnoting something like " Columbus sailed on his first voyage in 1492 " . Really ? Where 'd you get that information ? Cite it !

sometimes wide , sometimes deep . I was looking for a book on alarm systems first and general home security second . Did this book fit the bill ? Let me say this book covers lots of related subjects , from history of locks and home automation to designing websites if you are a locksmith and want to have WWW presence and home safes . This book also has some manuals for some security - related products , including product warranties . So , while it covers lots of subjects and goes into technical details ex how to install , I did n't find substance I was looking for , so was somewhat disappointed . There is nothing in the book about alarm central station monitoring , nothing about specific panels and non - phone monitoring options internet and GSM . However , it does include interesting info about magnetic sensors that was new to me even after countless hours on internet forums and enough of other information that made me give this book a solid 3 stars could be even your mileage may vary though , especially if you are just looking for general home security information - in this case it would be a recommended buy .

Bizarre Tale . This story definitely qualifies for the term " bizarre tale " . From beginning to end it 's unique mysterious . These qualities keep you reading up until the most suspenseful page of all - the last . However , the last page leaves something to be desired . At times this tale that is woven for a baby of a sister , is hard to grasp . Other times things seem to come into focus . Through out all of the stories of sisters , brothers , mothers fathers , the ending is looming and is what the reader anxiously awaits - in order to get some clarification on events . Unfortunately , I felt that clarification never did come . I enjoyed the book , but was extremely diss apo in ted with the ending . I felt like I was left hanging , waiting for answers that never came . I do n't think I would recommend this book to anyone . The only reason I gave it three stars was because I did enjoy the stories so much and the suspense . But overall whatever the author was trying to pull off did not work for this reader .

Great finale , but feels like more to come . I just loved this final installment ! It was compelling , complex , mysterious , twisty , tear - jerking at times . everything a great book should be . We got to get into the heads of multiple characters whereas this is sometimes annoying , this time it was completely satisfying . I 'm a bit sad it 's over because I love the four main characters so much , but at the same time I 'm glad their story is complete . It also has the feel that things could start up again in the future , at least for Dani and Shazam , and Ryodan needs to get his happy ever after as well . I had the flu this past weekend , and reading this helped keep my mind off my problems and completely in the story . In fact , I had to force myself to put the book down last night at 1240 when I only had 25 left to read . Woke up this morning and , since I still do n't feel well , sat down and finished the rest of it right away .

Plot ? Characters ? Put the reader in the action ? Why would a ClancyJack Ryan novel do that ? The plot , characterization , and overall content of this book is surprisingly pathetic . Well - rounded veteran Clancy characters are barely paper - cutouts here . The author 's weakness in managing a Clancy - style plots t ream of interwoven elements , global and personal , was obvious early on with the First Lady 's summary dismissal to Nepal for the duration . Where Clancy put you in the action , where you felt as though the submarine Maine was sinking under your own feet or you were standing with the police officer in Denver as he rode out a nuclear blast inside an armored truck , is completely absent here . I finished the book , hoping for some redemption of the tale , but found nothing . Despite it having been purchased new for a significant sum , after completing the book I threw it in the trash .

Good Story Too Chopy . Although a great , great story , I do not share the appeal of this book like so many others . Why ? The format of the story was a bit annoying , which may be what intrigues many readers . The abrupt starts and stops of the various characters was distracting . Once I became engrossed in a particular character , the writer abruptly introduced and re - familiarized you with another character . This made me skip around to gain completion of the character , Caldonia , whom I was most interested in . I did this around page 267 out of 388 . I became utterly fascinated with her ability to manage the plantation after her husband 's death . I did have to go back and read all the subsequent pages of course , but I was so engrossed in HER story , I was disappointed when the author produced other characters or events . It 's written very much the way people talk or the way one would see a daytime soap opera I do n't like daytime soaps . This story , however is great ! I think it should be taught in history classes as I am sure many have not been acquainted with this side of slavery .
